channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Bill Clinton says he 'did nothing wrong' with Epstein as he faced grilling over their relationship
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton told members of Congress on Friday that he "did nothing wrong" in his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and saw no signs of Epstein's sexual abuse as he faced hours of grilling from lawmakers over his connections to the disgraced financier from more than two decades ago.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Bill Clinton told members of Congress on Friday that he "did nothing wrong" in his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and saw no signs of Epstein's sexual abuse as he faced hours of grilling from lawmakers over his connections to the disgraced financier from more than two decades ago.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How the federal government is painting immigrants as criminals on social media
item.description: Experts say this kind of media campaign is unprecedented and paints a distorted picture of immigrants and crime
item.content:encoded: Experts say this kind of media campaign is unprecedented and paints a distorted picture of immigrants and crime
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan

item.title: Colorado is making it a little easier to prove you exist
item.description: A woman born in Colorado has never had a birth certificate; her parents rejected such things. She's never gone to school, had a job or been on a plane. Revised rules mean she'll soon officially exist.
item.content:encoded: A woman born in Colorado has never had a birth certificate; her parents rejected such things. She's never gone to school, had a job or been on a plane. Revised rules mean she'll soon officially exist.
item.dc:creator: Dan Boyce

item.title: A journalist early to the Jeffrey Epstein story reflects on the latest news
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with journalist Tina Brown, one of the first to report about Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse, about the fallout of the Epstein files.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with journalist Tina Brown, one of the first to report about Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse, about the fallout of the Epstein files.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Pentagon puts Scouts 'on notice' over DEI and girl-centered policies
item.description: After threatening to sever ties with the organization formerly known as the Boy Scouts, Defense Secretary Hegseth announced a 6-month reprieve
item.content:encoded:
After threatening to sever ties with the organization formerly known as the Boy Scouts, Defense Secretary Hegseth announced a 6-month reprieve

(Image credit: X video by @SecWar / screengrab by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Graham Smith

item.title: NASA redirects Artemis moon mission program, postponing a planned astronaut landing
item.description: In shaking up its Artemis lunar program, NASA's new moon plan looks more like the Apollo missions of the 1960s. Instead of landing on the surface on Artemis III, NASA hopes to do so on Artemis IV.
item.content:encoded:
In shaking up its Artemis lunar program, NASA's new moon plan looks more like the Apollo missions of the 1960s. Instead of landing on the surface on Artemis III, NASA hopes to do so on Artemis IV.

(Image credit: Gregg Newton)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: OpenAI announces Pentagon deal after Trump bans Anthropic
item.description: Shortly after the president's ban of artificial intelligence company Anthropic, rival OpenAI announced it had done a deal with the Defense Department to provide its technology for classified networks.
item.content:encoded:
Shortly after the president's ban of artificial intelligence company Anthropic, rival OpenAI announced it had done a deal with the Defense Department to provide its technology for classified networks.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: HUD proposes time limits and work requirements for rental aid
item.description: The rule would allow housing agencies and landlords to impose such requirements "to encourage self-sufficiency." Critics say most who can work already do, but their wages are low.
item.content:encoded:
The rule would allow housing agencies and landlords to impose such requirements "to encourage self-sufficiency." Critics say most who can work already do, but their wages are low.

(Image credit: Jon Cherry)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Takeaways from Hillary Clinton's deposition. And, Paramount outbids for Warner Bros.
item.description: Hillary Clinton says the questioning in a closed-door deposition with the House Oversight Committee's Epstein investigation was repetitive. And, Paramount has outbid Netflix for Warner Bros.
item.content:encoded:
Hillary Clinton says the questioning in a closed-door deposition with the House Oversight Committee's Epstein investigation was repetitive. And, Paramount has outbid Netflix for Warner Bros.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: How U.S. allies are bracing for Trump's potential military action against Iran
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks former Ambassador and Middle East Special Envoy Dennis Ross about how U.S. allies are bracing for the possibility of U.S. military action against Iran.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks former Ambassador and Middle East Special Envoy Dennis Ross about how U.S. allies are bracing for the possibility of U.S. military action against Iran.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
